jobDescription: Our client is a leading provider of higher education information and services to individuals and their families. They are committed to developing technologies to ensure students have all the tools they may need to succeed. Our client is currently seeking a Data Analyst to join their dedicated team.Responsibilities of the Data Analyst:Ensure data quality and accuracy and perform daily operational tasksGather and assess business information needs and generate reports that fit requirementsReview and validate data in data aggregates for accuracyPrototype and develop reporting solutions and preparing and conducting testingFully research and analyze requirements to inform technical solutions, deliver concise answers to business questionsAcquire data from external sources and internally and integrate into enterprise platformsRequirements of the Data Analyst:Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent experienceAt least 2 years of experience as a data analystExpert-level SQL coding skillsExperience with T-SQL or PL/SQLAbility to provide high quality deliverablesComfortable in a fast-paced, team based environmentExcellent analytical skills with the ability to provide reports to answer business questionsStrong organizational and prioritization skills for on-time project deliveryExceptional communication skills, must be able to communicate effectively with business users Keywords: Data Analyst, SQL, T-SQL, PL/SQL, Communication  Job ID: 308259 About Eliassen Group: Eliassen Group provides strategic talent solutions to drive our clients innovation and business results. Leveraging nearly 30 years of success, our expertise in IT staffing, Agile consulting, creative services, managed services, and life sciences enables us to partner with our clients to execute their business strategy and scale effectively. Headquartered in Reading, MA and with offices from coast to coast, Eliassen Group offers local community presence, deep networks, as well as national reach. For more information, visit http://www.eliassen.com.  Eliassen Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.  Dont miss out on our referral program! If we hire a candidate that you refer us to then you can be eligible for a $1,000 referral check!
